articles.author: Kendra Andrews
articles.title: Golden State Warriors finish off Boston Celtics for fourth NBA title in eight years
articles.description: Two years after finishing with the NBA's worst record, the Golden State Warriors are back on top, finishing off the Boston Celtics in six games to capture their fourth title since 2015.
articles.content:
BOSTON -- For the fourth time in eight years, the Golden State Warriors have been crowned champions, as they eliminated the Celtics 103-90 on Thursday night in Game 6 of the NBA Finals.

articles.description: The Golden State Warriors are 5-1 favorites to win the 2023 NBA championship, followed closely by the Brooklyn Nets and Boston Celtics, who are each listed at 6-1.
articles.content:
The Golden State Warriors are the favorites to win next year's championship, but that could change during an offseason with big-name free agents on the market.

articles.title: Adam Hadwin fires 66 to take first-round lead at U.S. Open
articles.description: Adam Hadwin, who made the U.S. Open field as an alternate when Paul Casey withdrew with an injury, fired a 4-under 66 to take a one-shot lead after the first round.
articles.content:
BROOKLINE, Mass. -- Adam Hadwin wasn't officially in the U.S. Open until eight days ago. He walked off The Country Club on Thursday with his best score ever in a major for a one-shot lead.
